column13: "description": "A potential brute-force attack has been detected on the production web server
column14: targeting the root user via SSH. The attacker is originating from IP address 185.220.101.42 and has made 15 failed login attempts within 60 seconds. This activity poses a significant threat to the security of the server
column15: as a successful login could grant the attacker full administrative access."
column19: it is recommended to: (1) block the IP address 185.220.101.42 at the firewall level to prevent further attempts
column20: (2) consider implementing a rate-limiting or fail2ban policy to automatically block IP addresses with excessive failed login attempts
column21: (3) review and enforce strong password policies for all users
column23: and (4) monitor the server for any signs of unauthorized access or suspicious activity."}"

column13: "description": "A ransomware attack has been detected on the file server
column14: resulting in the encryption of multiple files with a .locked extension. A ransom note has been created
column15: indicating that the attacker is demanding payment in exchange for the decryption key. This type of attack can cause significant disruption to business operations and result in data loss if not addressed promptly."
column18: "recommended_action": "Immediate action is required to contain and mitigate the attack. Recommended steps include: (1) isolating the affected file server to prevent further encryption
column19: (2) taking a forensic image of the affected system for further analysis
column20: (3) contacting law enforcement and a cybersecurity incident response team
column21: (4) attempting to restore files from backups
column22: and (5) considering payment of the ransom only as a last resort
column23: if approved by management and law enforcement."}"

column13: "description": "A ransomware attack has been detected on the Windows file server
column14: with multiple files encrypted and a ransom note created. This is a critical threat that requires immediate attention to prevent further damage and potential data loss."
column15: "threat_type": "ransomware"

Avoid paying the ransom as it does not guarantee data recovery and may encourage further malicious activity."}"

column13: "description": "A suspicious SMB connection has been detected from 192.168.1.105 to the Windows file server at 192.168.1.110. This could indicate an attempt to access or exploit shared resources without authorization. The severity is categorized as medium because
column14: while the connection is suspicious
column15: there's no immediate indication of a critical breach or malware outbreak. However
column16: it warrants further investigation to determine the legitimacy and intent behind the connection."
column19: "recommended_action": "Investigate the source IP address (192.168.1.105) to determine if it is an authorized device on the network. Review recent file access logs on the server (192.168.1.110) for any suspicious activity. Consider blocking the IP address temporarily if it's not recognized as a legitimate device. Finally
column20: ensure that all SMB connections are encrypted and that the latest security patches are applied to both the client and server systems."}"

column13: "description": "A potentially malicious execution of PowerShell with encoded commands has been detected on a Windows file server. This could indicate an attempt to install malware
column14: exfiltrate data
column15: or establish a backdoor for future access. The use of encoded commands suggests an effort to avoid detection by traditional security monitoring tools."
column18: "recommended_action": "Immediately isolate the affected host (192.168.1.110) from the network to prevent potential lateral movement. Conduct a thorough forensic analysis of the system to identify the source and scope of the threat. Check for any unauthorized changes to system files
column20: or user accounts. Consider running a full antivirus scan and applying any pending security updates. Monitor network traffic and system logs for signs of continued malicious activity."}"
